message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.DS 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper uses an information-theoretic approach to characterize capacity limits of the fading MISO-BC under various transmission delay considerations. 
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper deals with dynamic resource allocation in a cellular wireless network with slow fading for support of data traffic having heterogeneous transmission delay requirements. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes an online resource allocation algorithm that is amenable to efficient cross-layer implementation of both physical (PHY) - layer multi-antenna transmission and media-access-control (MAC) - layer multiuser rate scheduling. 
4. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper deals with multi-antenna broadcasting, which is relevant to multimedia applications that require high data rates and reliable transmission. 
5. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper proposes a convex optimization framework for transmit optimization at the BS, which involves solving optimization problems with constraints, and an online resource allocation algorithm, which involves designing efficient algorithms for real-time operation.
